statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Charlotte 72, Georgia State 63
article.story: CHARLOTTE, N.C. (AP) -- Charlotte withstood a furious Georgia State rally, with guard Carlos Williams scoring seven of his game-high 15 points in the final 2:46 to fuel a 72-63 victory Saturday night. Williams' jumper with 2:46 to go not only gave the 49ers the lead for good but also ended a drought of more than 10 minutes without a field goal. E.J. Drayton added 14 points for Charlotte (2-2). Georgia State (2-3) was led by Rashad Chase with 13, Lance Perique with 12 and Ron Larris with 11. The 49ers led by as many as 16 points in the second half, but trailed Georgia State 63-62 following an inside basket by Perique with 3:46 remaining. Charlotte held its biggest advantage of the game at 50-34 following an inside basket by Drayton with 14:35 remaining, and appeared to be on the verge of blowing out the Panthers. But Georgia State rallied on a barrage of 3-point shots, sinking five over the next 6 1/2 minutes in a 19-6 run that cut the 49ers lead to 56-53 on a 3-pointer by Georgia States Ryan McBride with 7:45 left. It was one in a series of three 3-pointers by McBride during the Georgia State rally. The game was close the rest of the way. Charlotte missed all eight of its 3-point attempts in the second half, after hitting 6 of 13 from beyond the arc while building a 35-30 halftime lead. Freshman Ian Andersen provided a spark from off the bench for the 49ers, missing only one of his four 3-point attempts and scoring 11 first-half points. He made 4 of 6 shots overall in the opening half, after coming in with a season- and career-high of six points and a career field-goal percentage of .263 on 5-of-19 shooting in his first three games. But he was held scoreless in the second half. The 49ers led by as many as 13 points before going cold toward the end of the half, which allowed Georgia State to close with a 10-2 run to erase most of what had been a 33-20 Charlotte lead.
